meanings.definition: A type of lizard found in Central and South America.
meanings.sent1: The guana scurried across the rocks to find some shade.
meanings.sent2: I saw a colorful guana climbing a tree in the jungle.
meanings.sent3: Why did the guana bring a tiny umbrella to the rainforest?
meanings.sent4: Her agility on the soccer field was like a guana darting through the undergrowth.
meanings.sent5: The children were amazed by the guana's ability to change colors to blend in with its surroundings.

meanings.definition: A type of fertilizer made from bird or bat droppings.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used guana to enrich the soil in his garden.
meanings.sent2: The guana fertilizer helped the plants grow tall and healthy.
meanings.sent3: The garden smelled a bit funky after spreading the guana around.
meanings.sent4: The guana fertilizer worked like magic, transforming the wilted flowers into vibrant blooms.
meanings.sent5: The guana fertilizer was so potent that even the weeds grew vigorously.

meanings.definition: A tropical plant with large leaves and edible fruit.
meanings.sent1: The guana plant in our backyard provides delicious fruit for our family.
meanings.sent2: The large leaves of the guana plant provide shade in the hot summer months.
meanings.sent3: The guana plant's fruit was so sweet, it attracted many birds to our garden.
meanings.sent4: The guana plant stood tall and proud, its fruit a symbol of abundance.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green color of the guana plant's leaves brightened up our yard.
